did.abstract: Collection contains a letter, 1866, from Hannibal Hamlin to Henry A. Smythe, collector of the Port of New York, asking assistance for a friend. It also contains a blotter stamped "Library of Hannibal Hamlin," attached to a note by H. Borden Clarke, of Old Authors Farm, Ontario, claiming that the blotter was used to correct the Emancipation Proclamation.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Attorney and politician from Maine; was vice president of the United States (1861-1865). He was appointed by Andrew Johnson as collector for the Port of Boston but resigned over disagreements with Johnson about Reconstruction.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains a letter, 1866, from Hannibal Hamlin to Henry A. Smythe, collector of the Port of New York, asking assistance for a friend. It also contains a blotter stamped "Library of Hannibal Hamlin," attached to a note by H.
